thread.title: Funeral procession to be held for K9 Bumi
thread.title_full: Funeral procession to be held for K9 Bumi

author: Alex Kesler
title: Funeral procession to be held for K9 Bumi
text:
RICHLAND COUNTY, S.C. (WACH) â€” The Richland County Sheriff's Department has announced the funeral procession for K9 Officer Bumi.
The procession will begin on December 27 at 10 am.
Law enforcement will leave 1 Science Court and travel from Parklane Road, to Highway 277, to Elmwood Avenue, to Huger Street, to Gervais Street, to Meeting Street, and will end at 200 State Street in West Columbia.
The procession is for law enforcement only, but the community is invited to McAllister's Funeral Home.
READ MORE | [13-year-old among 2 arrested in fatal K9 Bumi shooting; 1 still wanted](https://wach.com/news/local/sheriff-leon-lott-to-provide-updates-on-k9-killing-richland-county-sheriffs-department-columbia-south-carolina)
Bumi was shot and killed Monday in the line of duty.
Deputies say a car was stolen in Columbia on Sunday at 9:30 a.m.
Deputies spotted the vehicle at 2:30 a.m. and pursued it, using stop sticks to deflate the tires. K9 Specialist Alan Ware and K9 Bumi were at the scene.
Bumi got out of Specialist Ware's sight and deputies heard gunshots. They rushed to the area and found Bumi, who was wearing his vest but had been shot at least three times.
A 16-year-old was arrested at the scene. He is charged with obstruction of justice, misprision, and a pickup order by DJJ.
The teen was on an ankle monitor that was not charged up, according to authorities.
A 13-year-old was arrested a day later.
According to authorities, the 13-year-old is accused of being the shooter.
The 13-year-old is charged with attempted murder, unlawful killing of a police dog, malicious injury to personal property over 10K, breach of peace high and aggravated nature, possession of a weapon under 18, unlawful carrying of a weapon, possession of a weapon during a violent crime, and possession of a stolen vehicle.
